trans-unit.source: Provides a means for creating a software component that can serialize any part of a Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) application's content to a manufacturer's proprietary format.

<xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsSerializerFactory> in the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization> namespace is Microsoft's implementation of this interface for serialized [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_metro](~/includes/tlasharptla-metro-md.md)] content.
Initializes an object derived from the abstract <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter"></xref> class for the specified <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> to which the returned object writes.
An object of a class derived from <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter"></xref>.
Gets the default extension for files of the manufacturer's proprietary format.
This method is most useful if the leading period is included, for example, ".zzz"
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> representing the proprietary format's default file extension.
Gets the public name of the manufacturer's serializing component.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> representing the public name of the serializing component.
Gets the name of the serializing component's manufacturer.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> representing the manufacturer's name.
Gets the web address of the serializing component's manufacturer.
A <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> representing the manufacturer's website.
